academic_structure.description: The program adopts a module-based system instead of a semester-based system.
details: There are 6 modules in one year.
Modules 1-2 cover two compulsory courses each.
Modules 3-5 include 5 elective courses in total, typically distributed as 2+2+1.

capstone.description: Capstone is a practical project where HKU collaborates with various companies.
details: The capstone project provides hands-on opportunities for HKU BA students.
It is one of the unique features of the HKU BA program.

graduation_flexibility.description: Students can choose to graduate in 1 or 2 years.
details: This flexibility allows students to participate in two campus recruitment seasons, which is a great advantage for fresh graduates.

gpa_scale.description: The maximum GPA at HKU is 4.3, corresponding to an A+ grade.
details: Each grade decreases the GPA by 0.3: A+ = 4.3, A = 4.0, A- = 3.7, and so on.
The graduation requirement for HKU BA students is an average GPA of at least 2.0, with no more than 2 failed courses.
Compulsory courses: Failed compulsory courses must be retaken in the following year.
Elective courses: Failed elective courses can be replaced by selecting a different elective course.
Retaken courses require an additional tuition fee.

bootcamp.description: A 10-day Bootcamp is held before the start of the program.
details: Covers foundational knowledge in mathematics, statistics, Python, R, and SQL.
Designed to help students transition from undergraduate to master's-level courses.
BA students are given priority for Bootcamp enrollment.

class_size.description: The program admits a large class size of 400 students.
details: With such a large cohort, it can be challenging to recognize all classmates even after graduation.
